metadata.description: Create a DC, a SQL Server 2022, and from 1 to 5 server(s) hosting a SharePoint Subscription / 2019 / 2016 farm with an extensive configuration, including trusted authentication, user profiles with personal sites, an OAuth trust (using a certificate), a dedicated IIS site for hosting high-trust add-ins, etc... The latest version of key softwares (including Fiddler, vscode, np++, 7zip, ULS Viewer) is installed. SharePoint machines have additional fine-tuning to make them immediately usable (remote administration tools, custom policies for Edge and Chrome, shortcuts, etc...).

variables.firewall_set_proxy_script: param([string]$proxyIp, [string]$proxyHttpPort, [string]$proxyHttpsPort, [string]$localDomainFqdn) $proxy = "http={0}:{1};https={0}:{2}" -f $proxyIp, $proxyHttpPort, $proxyHttpsPort; $bypasslist = "*.{0};<local>" -f $localDomainFqdn; netsh winhttp set proxy proxy-server=$proxy bypass-list=$bypasslist; $proxyEnabled = 1; New-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings" -Name "ProxySettingsPerUser" -PropertyType DWORD -Value 0 -Force; $proxyBytes = [system.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes($proxy); $bypassBytes = [system.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes($bypasslist); $defaultConnectionSettings = [byte[]]@(@(70, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, $proxyEnabled, 0, 0, 0, $proxyBytes.Length, 0, 0, 0) + $proxyBytes + @($bypassBytes.Length, 0, 0, 0) + $bypassBytes + @(1..36 | % { 0 })); $registryPaths = @("HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings", "HKLM:\Software\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings"); foreach ($registryPath in $registryPaths) { Set-ItemProperty -Path $registryPath -Name ProxyServer -Value $proxy; Set-ItemProperty -Path $registryPath -Name ProxyEnable -Value $proxyEnabled; Set-ItemProperty -Path $registryPath -Name ProxyOverride -Value $bypasslist; Set-ItemProperty -Path "$registryPath\Connections" -Name DefaultConnectionSettings -Value $defaultConnectionSettings; } Bitsadmin /util /setieproxy localsystem MANUAL_PROXY $proxy $bypasslist;

metadata.name: Virtual Machines
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Machine with one or multiple NICs and optionally one or multiple public IPs.
Optional. The disk name.
Optional. Specifies the size of an empty data disk in gigabytes.
Optional. Specifies how the virtual machine should be created.
Optional. Specifies whether data disk should be deleted or detached upon VM deletion.
Optional. Specifies the caching requirements.
Required. Specifies the ephemeral disk placement for the operating system disk.
Optional. Specifies the ephemeral Disk Settings for the operating system disk.
Optional. Specifies the storage account type for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk encryption set resource id for the managed disk.
Required. The managed disk parameters.
The type describing an OS disk.
Optional. The disk name. When attaching a pre-existing disk, this name is ignored and the name of the existing disk is used.
Optional. Specifies the logical unit number of the data disk.
Optional. Specifies the size of an empty data disk in gigabytes. This property is ignored when attaching a pre-existing disk.
Optional. Specifies how the virtual machine should be created. This property is automatically set to 'Attach' when attaching a pre-existing disk.
Optional. Specifies whether data disk should be deleted or detached upon VM deletion. This property is automatically set to 'Detach' when attaching a pre-existing disk.
Optional. Specifies the caching requirements. This property is automatically set to 'None' when attaching a pre-existing disk.
Optional. The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes. Ignored when attaching a pre-existing disk.

Optional. The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10. Ignored when attaching a pre-existing disk.
Optional. Specifies the storage account type for the managed disk. Ignored when attaching a pre-existing disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk encryption set resource id for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the resource id of a pre-existing managed disk. If the disk should be created, this property should be empty.
Required. The managed disk parameters.
Optional. The tags of the public IP address. Valid only when creating a new managed disk.
The type describing a data disk.
Required. Specifies the SSH public key data used to authenticate through ssh.
Required. Specifies the full path on the created VM where ssh public key is stored. If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file.
Optional. The name of the NIC configuration.
Optional. The suffix to append to the NIC name.

metadata.name: Public IP Addresses
metadata.description: This module deploys a Public IP Address.

Required. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

Optional. The domain name label scope. If a domain name label and a domain name label scope are specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system with a hashed value includes in FQDN.
Optional. The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
Required. The resource ID of the DDOS protection plan associated with the public IP address.
Optional. The DDoS protection plan associated with the public IP address.
Required. The DDoS protection policy customizations.
Required. The IP tag type.
Required. The IP tag.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.

Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.

Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

metadata.name: Virtual Machine Extensions
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Machine Extension.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual machine that extension is provisioned for. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the virtual machine extension.
Optional. The location the extension is deployed to.
Required. The name of the extension handler publisher.
Required. Specifies the type of the extension; an example is "CustomScriptExtension".
Required. Specifies the version of the script handler.

Required. Indicates whether the extension should use a newer minor version if one is available at deployment time. Once deployed, however, the extension will not upgrade minor versions unless redeployed, even with this property set to true.
Optional. How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific settings.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.

Optional. Indicates whether failures stemming from the extension will be suppressed (Operational failures such as not connecting to the VM will not be suppressed regardless of this value). The default is false.
Required. Indicates whether the extension should be automatically upgraded by the platform if there is a newer version of the extension available.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
The name of the extension.
The resource ID of the extension.
The name of the Resource Group the extension was created in.
The location the resource was deployed into.
